departure_soc_description: The starting SoC of the car.
reference_consumption_description: The reference consumption of the car_model. The default reference consumption for each car model is given by the get_carmodels method. Unless there is better information, use this default.
fast_charger_descripton: Charger types to be used in the route planning.
destination_arrival_soc_description: The minimum SoC allowed when arriving at the final destination.
charger_arrival_soc_description: The minimum SoC allowed when arriving at any charger or waypoint.
battery_degradation_description: The assumed battery degradation of the car compared to a brand new battery. Default is 5% for all cars.
time_charge_port_description: The overhead to add to the driving time and charging time for each charge stop. This typically accounts for finding the charger, connecting it and starting it. A higher value here will lead to fewer but longer charge stops.
reference_speed_description: A speed factor relative to the speed limits or estimated speed of the road. Default is 100, and e.g. 110 means 10% faster than speed limits.
maximum_speed_description: The maximum speed which the planner will allow for the car, even if speed limits allow more. This is mostly useful for very high speed highways, such as Autobahns.
adjust_speed_description: Allow the planner to lower the maximum speed for individual legs if this is needed to reach the next charger.
temperature_description: The outside temperature for the plan. This will affect consumption of the car model.
wind_description: The wind speed and direction for the plan.
road_conditions_description: This will increase the consumption according to a simple model of the road condition impact.
avoid_on_route_description: Avoid the route to include highways, ferries or tolls.
extra_weight_description: The extra weight assumed for the car for the plan. This will slightly increase the consumption (unless driving downhill).
reset_password_description: We just sent you an email with the instructions to restore your password.
premium_feature_description: This feature requieres a Premium account
forgot_email_sent: An password reset email has been sent
register_email_used: The user email is already registered
error_one_address: You cannot plan a route with a single address
invalid_plan: No valid plan found - this is the best attempt
could_not_calculate_plan: We could not calculate your plan
already_on_saved_plans: This plan is alreay on you saved plans
no_gps_position: We have not yet found your GPS position
set_home_work_description: To set yout Home or Work address, long press the map or click the options icon next to the directions box. You will get a new page with information about that adress and options to add it as Home or Work address.
quick_select_car: Quickly select car model without saving
link_description: Link your car to use realtime data for a better planning experience.
could_not_login: Couldn't login. Please double check your email and password.
could_not_link_token: Couldn't link the token. Please double check that you are providing a valid refresh token.
must_be_logged_in: You must be logged in to ABRP to use this function.
